name: hormonally

in a way that relates to hormones (= chemicals made by living cells that influence the development, growth, sex, etc. of an animal, and are carried around the body in the blood): The study shows that insomnia can be hormonally related. These kids have so much going on, both hormonally and socially.
More examplesFewer examplesThe contraceptive pill hormonally alters the uterus lining.Hormonally, a 19-year-old's testosterone levels are at their peak.Men and women become more hormonally similar after the age of 50.
